RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD OR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming races for $10,0 00 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRIP TO FREEDOM vied for the lead on the inside while in the two path, made a bid to shake clear leaving the turn and move out to the three path, thyen drew out in the lane to prove much the best under mild right handed crop urging. WITCHING tracked the pace along the inside, dropped back on the turn while still saving ground, then made a inside bid leaving the turn but could not gain on the winner while staying on for the place award. MAYSTART was bumped at the start, four wide on the turn, shifted in leaving the quarter pole, then finished willingly late. FIELD DAISEY chased the pace four wide and came five wide into the lane and weakened. MY LADY SLEW vied for the lead outside the winner and then pressed that rival three wide off the turn and was empty. NIFF broke in at the start bumping a rival, then settled on the inside and had no response.

ENTRY.NAME: Witching
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, rated back, inside bid, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Trip to Freedom
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, bid, 3 wide 1/4, drew clear, drew out, mild drive

ENTRY.NAME: My Lady Slew
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, pressed pace 3 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Maystart
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, 4 wide turn, shift in, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Niff
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in start, allowed to settle inside, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Field Daisey
ENTRY.OWNER: Bigelow Gail Parker Adam and Brown Kathleen J
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, came 5 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS OR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Claiming races for $17,500 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHIMMER ME TIMBERS was away alertly to set the early pace towards the inside, then came off the turn three wide and clear, then widened the margin in the stretch to prove best, driving. TEE BURNS was bumped at the start, stalked the early pace four wide, made a four wide bid on the turn but flattened out, held place award. TALKTOEACHOTHER was off a step slow, saved ground and made a bid on the turn but needed more late, bested rest. PINBALLER chased the pace two wide and lacked the needed rally. LUCKY SHOT tracked the early pace three wide, then shifted to the outside and came five wide into the lane and was empty. RIDING THE TRAIN was outrun early and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Shimmer Me Timbers
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, 2-3 wide turn, drew clear stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Pinballer
ENTRY.OWNER: Dundalk 5 LLC Wesley F Herek Racing Stable LLC and Ernie T Poulos Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 2 wide, lacked needed rally

ENTRY.NAME: Talktoeachother
ENTRY.OWNER: Puro Candelas LLC Candelas Jovany and Lawson Rachael
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, saved ground, needed more late, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Riding the Train
ENTRY.OWNER: Young Melvin Lee and Pearson Paul M
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Shot
ENTRY.OWNER: Dundalk 5 LLC Wesley F Herek Racing Stable LLC Stiff Ken and Stiff Tim
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, came 5 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Tee Burns
ENTRY.OWNER: Pohl Dennis Throm Keith H and Gavilsky II Lawrence
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, stalked pace 4 wide, bid 4 wide, held 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,500 (Claiming races for $6,250 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APRIL'S GEM set the pace on the inside while clear, then was challenged on the turn, dug in gamely leaving the quarter pole, then held on to prove best under a drive. PALACE MAGIC was bumped at the start, then steadied slightly and shifted out four wide, made a three wide move on the turn to press the winner, then had a long drive with that rival but was outfinished. CATCHUSIFYOUCAN was well placed early, then rated behind the leaders on the turn, angled out leaving the turn for aim, was slowly gaining but needed more. ALMAFUERTE stalked the pace three wide and came four wide into the lane and faded. KITTEN ROCKS was off a step slow, chased the pace and was three wide on the turn, came four wide off the turn and had no kick.

ENTRY.NAME: April's Gem
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, dug in 1/4, held on gamely, driving,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Tony Holmes & Dr. & Mrs. Walter Zent

ENTRY.NAME: Palace Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, shift 4 wide, 3 wide move, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Catchusifyoucan
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, inside turn, angled out upper, slowly gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Almafuerte
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Kitten Rocks
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, chased pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWISS GUARD was away alertly to set the early pace, drew clear on the turn and then drew off in the stretch to prove much the best under a hand ride. BLAME SHIFTER was off a step slow, settled into stride and advanced on the inside on the turn, then finished willingly to get the place award. MINING CAMP chased the early pace three wide, then angled in to the inside on the turn, angled out leaving the turn and was outfinished for the place award. MODIFIER hopped at the start, settled back and was on the inside on the turn, then found best stride late. CHERRY ORCHARD was off slowly, reserved early and lacked a rally. LOCOMOTE was off slowly and failed to menace. PASSING TIME vied for the early lead on the inside, then shifted out when the winner got to the front, three wide on the turn and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Blame Shifter
ENTRY.OWNER: Dundalk 5 LLC and Wes Herek Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, saved ground turn, willingly for place

ENTRY.NAME: Mining Camp
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, inside turn, angled out, outfinished 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Passing Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied early, shift out 7/16, 3 wide turn, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Cherry Orchard
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, reserved early, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Swiss Guard
ENTRY.OWNER: Vanden Berg Brittany A and Taylor Everett
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, drew clear turn, drew off, handily

ENTRY.NAME: Modifier
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, settled back, inside turn, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Locomote
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in e stimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG BLUE was bumped at the start, prompted the pace four wide, made a three wide bid on the turn, then dueled with the pace setter leaving the furlong marker and got up late to prove best under a drive. STORM'S REFLECTION set the pace on the inside, then was pressured on the turn, dug in gamely in the stretch but was caught late to just miss. RIP IT RYAN was allowed to settle early, made a four wide run on the turn but lacked the needed winning bid in the lane. WHERE'S LUCKY checked after the start and was relegated to the back on the inside, angled out in the stretch and had a belated rally. TOP NOTE was allowed to settle on the inside and weakened. FUTURE VISION pressed the pace three wide and was in between rivals at the half mile marker and then tired on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Top Note
ENTRY.OWNER: Hoffman Farms Racing LLC and Alexis Claire Racing Services LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Storm's Reflection
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, dug in gamely stretch, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Future Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, between horses 1/2, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Where's Lucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked after start, settled back, angled out stretch, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Big Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start,prompted pace 4 wide, bid 3 wide, long drive,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Rip It Ryan
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide turn, needed stretch bid, bested rest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 10500. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2022 - 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 19, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less n ot considered in eligibility and allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING TITO was away alertly to set a pressured pace on the inside, shook clear on the turn, then maintained a safe margin to the wire to prove best, driving. AGAVE KID pressed the pace two wide, came three wie into the lane tracking the winner, kept on to hold the place award. ONE WAY HOME showed good early speed on the inside but was shuffled back entering the turn, saved ground on the turn, then shifted out in the lane and finished well. D'FEVER broke in the air at the start, far back early, angled out in the stretch and closed well late. RISKY BOY stalked the pace three wide, came four wide into the lane and had no kick. DEVIL'S RULE was rated early, made a inside bid but flattened out. BOOM FIVE THOUSAND was unhurried early, far back and then had a belated rally. BEL BIMBO failed to menace. GEMO RAIN chased the early pace five wide, steadied near the seven sixteenths, wide on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: One Way Home
ENTRY.OWNER: Martinez Ralph and Martin Paul E
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed inside, shuffled back, shift out 2 wide,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Agave Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, came 3 wide, kept on, held place

ENTRY.NAME: D'fever
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air, far back early, angled out, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Devil's Rule
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early, inside bid, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: King Tito
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pressured pace inside, shook clear, kept safe,

ENTRY.NAME: Boom Five Thousand
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, far back, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Risky Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Gemo Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 5 wide, steadied 7/16, wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Bel Bimbo
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 31500. FOR ILLINOIS REGISTERED, CONCEIVED AND/OR FOALED. Three Year Olds and Upward Which Have Not Won A State Bred Race Other Than Maiden, Claiming, Or Starter or Which Have Never Won Two Races. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race s ince February 19 Allowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ASTI SKY broke sharply, tracked the pace after WILDWOOD DREAMER took the lead near the nine sixteenths, tracked in the three to four path on the turn, came three wide into the lane, loomed outside the leader through midstretch, drove to the lead near the sixteenth and edged ahead. WILDWOOD DREAMER was nudged inside early and took the lead near the nine sixteenths, set the pace while clear in the two path around the far turn, was driven inside of ASTI SKY in the lane, grudgingly relinquished the lead near the sixteenth mark and kept on a clear second best. DEMAND RANSOM broke outward and bumped COMING UP ACES in the opening strides, tracked the leading pair down the backstretch and in the three path on the turn, raced into the lane inside of ASTI SKY, lacked the needed kick to match that foe, but chased on mildly and held clear for the show. COMING UP ACES was bumped between DEMAND RANSOM and SENOR MIKE in the opening strides, trailed down the backstretch and in the three path on the turn, came into the lane inside and ultimately proved no threat. W W TRAFALGAR reared at the start and broke slowly, inched up inside of SENOR MIKE approaching the half, chased well behind the leading trio while hugging the rail on the turn, was driven three wide between horses in the lane, drifted out and lacked the needed rally. SENOR MIKE broke outward and bumped COMING UP ACES in the opening strides, chased well behind the leading trio down the back straight, was driven in the four to five path on the turn, and had no rally in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Wildwood Dreamer
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: to lead inside 9/16, clear 2p turn, headed 1/16, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: W W Trafalgar
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: reared start, rail turn, driven 3w upper, drift out, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Demand Ransom
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in, bumped foe, tracked, 3p turn, no match upper, mildly

ENTRY.NAME: Coming Up Aces
ENTRY.OWNER: Glander Jessamyn L and Miller Racing Stable Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped between opening strides, trail 3p turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Senor Mike
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, bumped foe, driven 4-5p turn, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Asti Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, track from 9/16, 3-4p turn, driven 3w, led 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 8 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 31500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since February 1 9 Allowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EDITOR IN CHIEF tracked the pace on the inside, made a inside bid leaving the turn to gain a short lead, then edged clear to prove best under a drive. HIGH BROW was allowed to settle early on the outside, made a four wide bid leaving the turn but hung in the final furlong, second best. MISTER CHARMING was allowed to settle early on the inside, made a inside bid leaving the turn but flattened out, bested rest. PAPA'S LUCKY SEVEN was reserved early, angled out in the lane and had a belated rally. EVERLOVINGHAND set the pace while racing off the inside, then was headed and drifted out leaving the turn and gave way. COWBOYS DREAM was void of early speed and never factored. BEARS WATCHING was settled early in between rivals and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Cowboys Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Mister Charming
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, inside bid, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Editor in Chief
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, bid inside upper, edged clear stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Bears Watching
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, between horses, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Papa's Lucky Seven
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, angled out stretch, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: High Brow
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle 4 wide, bid 4 wide, hung, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Everlovinghand
ENTRY.OWNER: Cox John E Basler Thomas J and Pohl Dennis
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace off rail, drifted out upper stretch, gave way,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 9 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 10500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MADLY set the early pace on the inside, three wide off the turn and then drew clear by the furlong marker and then drew off while drifting out. LADA KALINA prompted the pace three wide, came four wide into the lane, could not go with the winner while staying on for the place award, second best. BUMPER GIRL was allowed to settle early, saved ground on the turn and lacked the needed winning stretch bid, bested rest. EVIE JEAN was allowed to settle early, came six wide into the lane and passed the tiring rivals. AMARI S. was bumped at the start, settled four wide and had no rally. PRINCESS TONI broke in at the start, settled between rivals and lacked a rally. TWICK OR TWEAT was fractious in the gate, off slowly and not a factor. TIS SYRIAN KITTY was bumped at the start and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Madly
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, 3 wide into lane, drifted out lane, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Evie Jean
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 6 wide upper stretch,passed tiring rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Lada Kalina
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Twick Or Tweat
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, off slow, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Bumper Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, needed stretch bid

ENTRY.NAME: Tis Syrian Kitty
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Amari S.
ENTRY.OWNER: Lynch Harry E and Couch Ron
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, settled 4 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Toni
ENTRY.OWNER: Megson Berva and Hooves and Saddles LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in start, settled between horses, lacked rally
